story.text: (Amounts in U.S. dollars)MONTREAL Jan 2 (Reuters) - Alcan Inc. AL.TO (AL.N) said on Tuesday it plans to review a British Columbia regulatory agency's rejection of a power purchase pact and its potential impact on the company's proposed $1.8 billion smelter expansion at Kitimat. Alcan, the world's second-largest maker of primary aluminum, said the British Columbia Utilities Commission rejected the amended and restated long-term energy purchase agreement between the company and B.C. Hydro regarding the Kitimat expansion. Approval of the power contract was one of three conditions Alcan set for the modernization of Kitimat, which would expand the smelter's annual output capacity by more than 60 percent to about 400,000 tonnes a year. ($1=$1.16 Canadian)
story.title: alcan says it reviews b . c . power pact rejection
